intro: Apocynum hypericifolium var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaf dogbane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It features opposite, lanceolate leaves that are typically 3–8 cm long and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in late summer, followed by orange-red berries that contain toxic seeds. It is part of the Apocynaceae family, known for its milky sap and medicinal properties. This species is often found in moist woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
